description: Bridge Axiom Templates for Ecological-Financial Translation

changelog.changes: Added uncertainty quantification to all axiom coefficients: ci_low, ci_high, distribution, study_sample_size, effect_size_type, extraction_note. BA-001 through BA-004 have research-grounded bounds; BA-005 through BA-012 flagged as estimated_uncertainty where literature bounds unavailable.
BA-001: Corrected primary DOI (was pointing to wrong paper), updated coefficients with verified 2024 WTP model source (Marcos-Castillo et al.); fixed secondary DOI typo (9207->9198z for Uyarra 2009)

axioms.name: mpa_biomass_dive_tourism_value
axioms.description: Fish biomass increases in MPAs drive increased diver willingness-to-pay and tourism revenue
axioms.pattern: IF full_protection(Site) THEN biomass_increase(Site, 113%) AND wtp_increase(Site, 84%) AND revenue_contribution(biomass, 47%)

wtp_increase_for_biomass_max_percent.extraction_note: 84% is stated as upper bound ('up to 84%'); lower bound estimated from methodology (random forest on 27,609 dive sites). Main text, Results section.

biomass_contribution_to_revenue_percent.extraction_note: 47% stated as point estimate, no CI in main text. Bounds estimated from model decomposition (biomass 47% + biodiversity 49% + MPA name 4% = 100%).

average_biomass_increase_full_protection.extraction_note: Mean 113% with std dev 133% from global analysis. CI estimated as mean +/- 1 std dev, clamped at 50% lower bound.

global_additional_revenue_usd_millions.extraction_note: $616M point estimate, no CI in paper. Bounds estimated at +/-35% based on input parameter sensitivity.

sources.citation: Cabral RB et al. 2025. Scientific Reports
sources.finding: Global bioeconomic model: divers willing to pay up to 84% more for biomass increases; 47% of economic improvements from biomass gains

sources.citation: Uyarra MC et al. 2009. Environmental Management
sources.finding: Divers select destinations based on marine life quality and quantity

caveats: Willingness-to-pay varies by diver experience and destination
Effect magnitude depends on baseline conditions
MPA name effect provides immediate value before biological recovery
84% WTP figure is an upper bound, not a mean estimate

example_calculation.interpretation: Full protection -> 113% biomass increase -> up to 84% higher WTP -> 47% of total revenue improvement

axioms.methodology_note: Based on willingness-to-pay demand curve estimation, not simple linear elasticity

axioms.name: notake_mpa_biomass_multiplier
axioms.description: No-take MPAs accumulate fish biomass relative to unprotected areas
axioms.pattern: IF mpa_type(Site, 'no_take') AND enforced(Site, TRUE) AND age_years(Site, N) THEN biomass_ratio(Site, f(N))

biomass_ratio_vs_unprotected.extraction_note: Global meta-analysis of 82 MPA studies. 95% CI [4.5, 8.9]. Only 18/82 provided temporal data for trend detection.

biomass_ratio_vs_partial_protection.extraction_note: Derived from same meta-analysis. CI estimated proportionally from full protection ratio CI.

recovery_rate_per_year.extraction_note: Recovery rate from temporal subset (18 studies). Bounds estimated from study-to-study variation.

sources.citation: Hopf JK et al. 2024. Ecological Applications
sources.finding: Global meta-analysis of no-take MPA effectiveness: 82 studies, mean biomass ratio 6.70x
NEOLI criteria determine MPA conservation outcomes

example_calculation.interpretation: 10-year-old enforced no-take reserve has 670% of unprotected biomass

axioms.name: sea_otter_kelp_carbon_cascade
axioms.description: Sea otter presence drives trophic cascade increasing kelp carbon storage
axioms.pattern: IF otter_presence(Site, TRUE) THEN carbon_storage_multiplier(Site, 12) AND carbon_value_usd(Site, V)

npp_with_otters_g_c_m2_yr.extraction_note: Range 313-900 from 40 years of kelp data, Vancouver Island to Aleutians. Midpoint 607 used as mode.

npp_without_otters_g_c_m2_yr.extraction_note: Range 25-70 from same dataset. Midpoint 48 used as mode.

npp_multiplier.extraction_note: Computed from NPP range endpoints: min ratio 313/70=4.5, max ratio 900/25=36. Central estimate 12x.

carbon_storage_increase_tg.extraction_note: Explicit range 4.4-8.7 Tg C from paper. Midpoint 6.55 as mode.

carbon_value_usd_million.extraction_note: Explicit range $205-408M at $47/tonne (2012 European Carbon Exchange price). Midpoint $307M as mode.

sources.citation: Wilmers CC et al. 2012. Frontiers in Ecology and the Environment
sources.finding: Sea otters increase kelp carbon storage worth $205-408M (40 years of data, Vancouver Island to Aleutians)

context_dependency.reference: Selden et al. 2024 PNAS - muted cascade at San Nicolas Island

axioms.name: coral_reef_flood_protection
axioms.description: Coral reef structural integrity reduces coastal flood damages
axioms.pattern: IF reef_condition(Site, C) AND reef_area_km2(Site, A) THEN flood_protection_value_usd(Site, f(C, A))

global_flood_protection_value_usd_billio.extraction_note: 71,000 km reef coastline at 2km resolution (~35,500 profiles). No explicit CI in paper; ~10% sensitivity from friction/wave parameters. 100-year storm scenario.

healthy_reef.extraction_note: 97% from Ferrario et al. 2014 meta-analysis of reef wave attenuation. Bounds from study variation.

degraded_reef.extraction_note: Estimated from reef structural complexity loss scenarios. Wider bounds due to variable degradation states.

damage_increase_without_reefs_percent.extraction_note: 91% for 100-year storms. Sensitivity: 10% change in run-up from friction parameters, 2% per 10cm depth. Bounds estimated.

sources.citation: Beck MW et al. 2018. Nature Communications
sources.finding: Coral reefs provide $272B/year in global flood protection for 100-year storms (71,000 km coastline)

axioms.name: mangrove_flood_protection
axioms.description: Mangrove extent and width provide coastal flood protection
axioms.pattern: IF mangrove_area_ha(Site, A) THEN flood_protection_value_usd_yr(Site, A * V_ha)

global_protection_value_usd_billion_yr.extraction_note: Point estimate from paper; bounds estimated at +/-20% based on typical ESV transfer error.

storm_surge_decay_rate_cm_per_km.extraction_note: Bounds estimated from variation in mangrove density and structure.

value_per_ha_yr_mean_usd.extraction_note: Mean $4,185, median $239, range $100-$57,000 from meta-analysis. Extreme right skew indicates lognormal.

sources.citation: Menendez P et al. 2020. Scientific Reports

axioms.name: mangrove_fisheries_production
axioms.description: Mangrove extent correlates with adjacent fisheries catches
axioms.pattern: IF mangrove_fringe_ha(Site, A) THEN fisheries_value_usd_yr(Site, A * V_ha)

value_per_ha_yr_median_usd.extraction_note: Median value from Gulf of California study. Bounds estimated at +/-60% from cross-site variation.

species_proportion_mangrove_dependent.extraction_note: Proportion of species dependent on mangroves. Bounds estimated from regional variation.

sources.finding: Mangroves in Gulf of California increase fishery yields

sources.citation: Carrasquilla-Henao M et al. 2025. Comms Earth & Environ

axioms.name: mangrove_carbon_stock
axioms.description: Mangrove ecosystems store exceptional carbon per hectare
axioms.pattern: IF mangrove_condition(Site, C) THEN carbon_stock_mg_ha(Site, f(C))

undisturbed_mg_c_ha.extraction_note: From Donato et al. 2011. Bounds estimated at +/-20% from site-level variation in Indo-Pacific mangroves.

sequestration_rate_g_c_m2_yr.extraction_note: From Murdiyarso et al. 2023. Bounds estimated from cross-site variation in Indonesian mangroves.

axioms.comparison: 4x more carbon than most tropical forests

sources.citation: Donato DC et al. 2011. Nature Geoscience
sources.finding: Mangroves among most carbon-rich forests in tropics

sources.citation: Murdiyarso D et al. 2023. Carbon Balance Management
sources.finding: Indonesian mangrove emission factors by condition

axioms.name: seagrass_carbon_credit_value
axioms.description: Seagrass conservation and restoration generate carbon credit revenue
axioms.pattern: IF seagrass_project_type(Site, T) AND area_ha(Site, A) THEN carbon_revenue_usd_10yr(Site, f(T, A))

carbon_credit_range_usd_per_ha.extraction_note: Range $198-$15,337/ha from Duarte et al. 2025. Midpoint $7,768 as central estimate. Extreme range reflects project type variation.

net_offset_t_co2e_ha_yr.extraction_note: From Oreska et al. 2020. Bounds estimated at +/-50% from site-level variation.

sources.citation: Duarte CM et al. 2025. npj Ocean Sustainability
sources.finding: Seagrass carbon credit revenue varies by management approach

sources.citation: Oreska MPJ et al. 2020. Scientific Reports
sources.finding: Net GHG offset from seagrass restoration

axioms.name: mangrove_restoration_bcr
axioms.description: Mangrove restoration yields positive benefit-cost ratios
axioms.pattern: IF restoration_investment_usd(Site, I) AND discount_rate(R) THEN bcr(Site, f(I, R))

bcr_range.extraction_note: BCR range 6.35-15.0 from Zeng et al. 2025. Midpoint 10.68 as mode.

sources.citation: Zeng Y et al. 2025. Nature Communications

axioms.name: kelp_forest_global_value
axioms.description: Kelp forests provide substantial ecosystem services globally
axioms.pattern: IF kelp_forest_area_ha(Site, A) THEN ecosystem_service_value_usd_yr(Site, A * V_ha)

global_value_usd_billion_yr.extraction_note: From Eger et al. 2023. Bounds estimated at +/-30% based on per-hectare value range.

value_per_ha_yr_range_usd.extraction_note: Range $64,400-$147,100/ha/yr from paper. Midpoint $105,750 as central estimate.

sources.citation: Eger AM et al. 2023. Nature Communications
sources.finding: Global kelp forest ecosystem service valuation

axioms.name: mpa_climate_resilience
axioms.description: MPAs enhance ecosystem resilience to climate disturbances

kelp_recovery_premium_percent.extraction_note: 8.5% from Ortiz-Villa et al. 2024 California MPA study. Bounds estimated from cross-site variation.

coral_stability_increase_percent.extraction_note: Range 21-38% from Mellin et al. 2016. Midpoint 30% as mode.

coral_disturbance_impact_reduction_perce.extraction_note: Bounds estimated at +/-50% around point estimate.

sources.citation: Ortiz-Villa A et al. 2024. Global Change Biology
sources.finding: California MPAs show 8.5% kelp increase post-heatwave

sources.citation: Mellin C et al. 2016. Ecology Letters
sources.finding: MPAs increase coral reef community resilience by 21-38%

axioms.name: reef_degradation_fisheries_loss
axioms.description: Coral reef structural degradation reduces fisheries productivity

productivity_loss_at_degradation_percent.extraction_note: 35% from Rogers et al. 2018, with stated range 25-50%. Direct from paper.

sources.citation: Rogers A et al. 2018. Journal of Applied Ecology
sources.finding: Reef degradation causes 25-50% fisheries productivity loss

usage_guidance.confidence_propagation: When chaining multiple axioms, multiply confidence intervals
usage_guidance.uncertainty_handling: Always report ranges, not point estimates
usage_guidance.source_verification: Cross-reference with source DOIs before using in financial context

uncertainty_types.research_grounded: CI derived from source paper data (tables, figures, or stated ranges)
uncertainty_types.estimated_uncertainty: CI estimated from methodology (e.g., +/-20% transfer error, proportional scaling). Flagged for future refinement with primary literature.
